commit.message:
GEODE-7585: Creating an API for starting a locator in the membership package

Creating a new MembershipLocator and MembershipLocatorBuilder that are used to
create the membership locator. These classes encapsulate the TcpServer,
PrimaryHandler, and GMSLocator that were previously held by InternalLocator.

Getting rid of some intermdiate classes that wrapped the GMSLocator -
NetLocator and GMSLocatorAdapter.

Refactoring the restart logic out of PrimaryHandler. There is now a separate
RestartHandler, and a separate collection that tracks RestartHandlers. Removing
RestartableTcpHandler.

Fixing integration test failures

I moved the logic where the static Locator.hasLocator method is called. Some of
the tests were relying on this logic being in membership to realize that the
member was itself a locator. I changed those tests to specify that that are
using the LOCATOR_DM_TYPE.

Removing a call to restarting with a bunch of null fields. That call used to be
there and have no effect, but with the new RestartHandlers it was actually
passing the nulls down.

Fixing more integration test failures

Restoring the original location of the Locator.hasLocators check, but
ecapsulating it in MembershipConfig.

Changing the vm kind if Locator.hasLocator was true lead to additional
integration test failures.
